primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The rescue of Rahab from the destruction of Jericho, serving as a type for the rescue of the soul from the 'siege of life and death' through the 'Scarlet Thread' of Christ.

subject.identificatie: Christ (as the Scarlet Thread/Mediator) and God (as the ultimate Rescuer).
tekstueel_bewijs: Joshua told the invaders to watch out for the house of Rahab.
Christ is that scarlet thread behind which our souls are safe.
God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself.

object.identificatie: Salvation/Safety from the 'orgy of destruction' and the 'siege of death'.
tekstueel_bewijs: bring all of them safely out from the path of destruction and death
our own redemption and salvation in Jesus Christ

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Covenant Promise.
tekstueel_bewijs: the house protected by a promise
God has not left himself without witnesses
we who trust him may have the blessed assurance
we who sometimes were far off are made nigh
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to identify with the Receiver (Rahab) who must 'throw in' with God.

helper.identificatie: The Scarlet Thread (The Blood of Christ/The Promise).
tekstueel_bewijs: Christ is that scarlet thread, the sinner's perfect plea
a hiding place when the storms are raging
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Helper (Christ).

tegenstander.identificatie: The Siege of Life and Death / The Enemies of the Soul.
tekstueel_bewijs: These two mighty warriors come roaring through where we live.
Death cuts us down with swift, devastating strokes.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but the ontological reality of death and the 'orgy of destruction' that no human can withstand.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response: Rahab 'throwing in' on the side of God and the hearer joining the 'community of life'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Rahab
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Alignment with the community of life/The Church.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon suggests that because the siege is coming, one must choose the community of life (Secondary) to be found behind the Scarlet Thread (Primary).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God was in Christ, reconciling the world
Joshua told the invaders to watch out
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we come again to the season of Lent
we really do not need to be told how old we are looking

voorbeelden: we are called on to do in our relationship to Jesus Christ
a strong desire to be a Christian
his delight is in the law of the Lord
make a little plainer to people what Jesus meant
Christ is that scarlet thread behind which our souls are safe
They [Life/Death] defeat the shrewdest minds [Human lack of power]

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the total lack of human power (Pouvoir) against death, positioning Christ as the sole source of power/safety.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the inevitability of S2 (Death) to the failure of ~S1 (Decency/Prosperity) to the safety of S1 via the 'Scarlet Thread'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Promise'—the external sign that halts the destruction.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; death is described as a 'warrior' that 'crushes the stoutest hearts'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While there is a call to 'throw in' with God, the engine of the sermon is the objective work of Christ as a 'hiding place' against an invincible opponent (Death).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Rahab threw in on the side of the purposes of God... this is what we are called on to do.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Active Subject in Salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto himself.
These warriors, life and death, ride through the land bringing down the highest.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Rahab is used as an example of choosing God, but the sermon quickly pivots to her being a recipient of a promise she did not create.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already leans theocentric by focusing on the 'Scarlet Thread' (Christ) rather than Rahab's 'faith' or 'bravery'.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is an external rescue from a cosmic siege.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The Rahab narrative is expertly woven into the Lenten/Christological theme without forced allegorization.
spanning_punten: The tension between Rahab's 'lie' and her 'goodness' is left unresolved but subordinated to the 'future' purposes of God.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ our Passover... Christ the first fruits.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the 'Objective' work of Christ rather than the 'Subjective' work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin/Death is an inescapable siege that 'wears us down'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is structurally sound as a grace-oriented narrative. God/Christ is the primary actant of rescue, and the human actant is the beneficiary of a promise.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The 'Community of Life' section briefly shifts the focus to human 'relish' and 'desire'.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Ensure the 'desire' is seen as a gift of the Scarlet Thread, not a prerequisite.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Frame the 'relish for worship' as the first sign of being rescued, rather than the means of rescue.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the Lenten theme of human helplessness.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Death) is already sufficiently terrifying.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (The Thread) clearly precedes and enables the Ethics (The Community).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that uses a narrative type to ground the abstract work of Christ in a concrete story of rescue.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Scarlet Thread' metaphor's beauty; Greimas shows it is the functional 'Helper' that changes the Subject's fate.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might worry about the historical Rahab; semiotics focuses on how the 'Rahab-role' functions for the hearer today.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-Switch' where the hearer's inability to fight 'Death' is met by Christ's 'Pouvoir-faire'.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Moral Influence' trap by emphasizing the 'siege' which requires more than just a good example.
